com.arthenica.mobileffmpeg

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arthenica.mobileffmpeg.Log

  • public class Log
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is used to process stdout and stderr logs from native libraries.

    By default stdout and stderr is redirected to /dev/null in Android. This class redirects these streams to Logcat in order to view logs printed by FFmpeg native libraries.

    Alternatively, it is possible not to print messages to Logcat and pass them to a callback function. This function can decide whether to print these logs or ignore them according to its own rules.

    Since:
    v1.0

      • enableCallbackFunction

        public static void enableCallbackFunction(android.arch.core.util.Function<byte[],java.lang.Void> newCallbackFunction)

        Sets a callback function to receive logs from FFmpeg native libraries.

        Parameters:
        newCallbackFunction - callback to receive logs

      • log

        public static void log(byte[] logMessage)

        Main method called by JNI part to redirect log messages. It is not designed to be called manually by Java classes.

        Parameters:
        logMessage - log message

      • startNativeCollector

        public static int startNativeCollector()

        Starts native log collector.

        Returns:
        zero on success, non-zero if an error occurs

      • stopNativeCollector

        public static int stopNativeCollector()

        Stops native log collector.

        Returns:
        zero on success, non-zero if an error occurs
